author: wtopstaff
title: Cardinals-Steelers Capsule
text:
By The Associated Pres October 15, 2015 1:34 pm 
ARIZONA (4-1) at PITTSBURGH (3-2) 
Sunday, 1 p.m. ET, Fox 
OPENING LINE — Cardinals by 2½ 
RECORD VS. SPREAD — Cardinals 4-1, Steelers 3-0-2 
SERIES RECORD — Steelers lead 33-23-3 
LAST MEETING — Steelers beat Cardinals 32-20, Oct. 23, 2011 
LAST WEEK — Cardinals beat Lions 42-17; Steelers beat Chargers 24-20 
AP PRO32 RANKING — Cardinals No. 6, Steelers No. 9 
CARDINALS OFFENSE — OVERALL (6), RUSH (3), PASS (10). 
CARDINALS DEFENSE — OVERALL (9), RUSH (11), PASS (13). 
STEELERS OFFENSE — OVERALL (13), RUSH (13), PASS (19). 
STEELERS DEFENSE — OVERALL (18), RUSH (13), PASS (20). 
STREAKS, STATS AND NOTES — Steelers have won four of last five meetings, including 27-23 win in 2009 Super Bowl. … Cardinals coach Bruce Arians worked as Pittsburgh’s offensive coordinator from 2004-11, winning two Super Bowl rings. … Pittsburgh offensive coordinator Todd Haley served in same role for Cardinals in 2007-08, helping Arizona reach its only Super Bowl. …. Arizona’s plus-100 point differential is greatest through five games since 2007 Patriots. … Cardinals lead NFL in points (190) and touchdowns (24). … Arizona QB Carson Palmer’s 13 touchdown passes are tied with Packers QB Aaron Rodgers for NFL lead. … Cardinals’ 4.96 yards per carry tops league. … Steelers are 23-5-1 at Heinz Field against NFC teams. … Pittsburgh RB Le’Veon Bell is third in NFL in yards from scrimmage since returning from two-game suspension. … Steelers have 16 sacks through five weeks. They had 33 total in 2014. … Pittsburgh WR Martavis Bryant should make season debut. He missed first four games due to suspension and sat out last week with knee injury. … Pittsburgh QB Michael Vick is averaging only 6.29 yards per pass attempt while filling in for injured Ben Roethlisberger (knee). Fantasy Tip: Cardinals WR Larry Fitzgerald leads NFL in touchdown catches (six) and has averaged seven receptions for 108 yards in three games against Pittsburgh. 
___
